text: Jimmy Carr (born 15 September 1972) is an English-Irish comedian. He is the presenter of 8 out of 10 Cats on Channel 4 and has appeared on many TV shows on the same channel and on others. He travels around the country and performs a lot of comedy on stage (stand-up comedy). He is one of the UK's most successful comedians.BBC News - Profile: Jimmy Carr ==Personal life== Carr has dual citizenship - British and Irish. He was born in London to Irish immigrant parents. He has a degree in political science from the University of Cambridge. He lives with his girlfriend, Karoline Copping, in North London. She works for Channel Five. Carr is an atheist. He used to be a Christian. Importantly, because of his religion, he did not have sex until he was 26.Will Jimmy Carr's career survive the tax avoidance furore? He stopped being a Christian in his mid-20s. ==Criticism== Some people, including a Member of Parliament, journalists and other comedians, have criticized Carr. Some of his jokes and comedy are seen by some as being offensive. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from London Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:British stand-up comedians Category:Channel 4 presenters Category:Comedians from London Category:English atheists Category:English movie actors Category:English television presenters Category:English television writers Category:Irish comedians Category:Irish movie actors Category:Irish television personalities Category:Irish writers Category:People from the London Borough of Hounslow Category:Writers from London
title: Jimmy Carr
